text:
Hi, we have a deprecated module in our template, "*Custom HubL*", that we would like to update. We have used the module "*HTML*" instead, but we get the error message "*HTML fields can't contain HubL*" when we mix HubL and HTML in this module. It seems to work when published, but we would like to be sure nothing breaks later.

What module do you use or recommend for a mix of HTML and HubL?
Greatful for any advice :pray::skin-tone-5:
When you’re creating a new file into the design manager, hust use  the “module” voice and then “page template” and choose if local or global :slightly_smiling_face:
I’d try doing this in a d&d DM template, publish it, then clone that template to html and look at what the code outputs

The default state of booleans inside repeater groups is not respected.
• If the booleans are set to true by default, the CMS does not recognize it until a change occurs
• if the boolean is outside of a repeater group, then it’s default state _is_ respected
